Tell us when you're moving home and update your council tax details.

Why you need to tell us

You must tell us when you move home so we can:

  • Stop council tax at your old address
  • Start council tax at your new address
  • Make sure you pay the right amount
  • Send your bills to the correct address

Tell us as soon as you know your moving date. Don't wait until after you've moved.

Tell us you're moving

Update your address online through your My Gloucester account. You'll need your moving date and new address.

Update your address

Who pays council tax when you move

Moving out

You're responsible for council tax at your old address until:

  • The date you move out, or
  • The date a new person moves in (whichever comes first)

If the property is empty after you leave, you may still have to pay until someone else moves in or the property is sold.

Moving in

You're responsible for council tax at your new address from:

  • The date you move in, or
  • The date you become the owner or tenant (whichever comes first)

If you live with other people

If you live with other adults, you're usually all responsible for the council tax bill together. This is called joint liability.

Example: If you rent a house with 2 friends, all 3 of you are responsible for paying the council tax. We can ask any one of you to pay the full amount.

Married couples and civil partners

If you're married or in a civil partnership and live together, you're both responsible for the council tax bill. This applies even if only one of you is the homeowner or named on the tenancy.

Moving within Gloucester

If you're moving to another property in Gloucester, we'll:

  • Close your account at your old address
  • Open a new account at your new address
  • Send you a new bill

If you pay by Direct Debit, we'll update your payments automatically.

Leaving Gloucester

If you're moving out of Gloucester, tell us your:

  • Moving date
  • New address (even if it's outside Gloucester)
  • Forwarding address for any letters

We'll send you a final bill showing what you owe up to your moving date. If you've paid too much, we'll refund you.

Moving to a different council: You'll need to contact your new council to set up council tax at your new address. They may have different charges and payment dates.

Moving to Gloucester

Welcome to Gloucester! When you move here, we'll send you a council tax bill for your new property.

What you need to do

  • Tell us your moving date
  • Register for a My Gloucester account to manage your council tax online
  • Set up a payment method (we recommend Direct Debit)

Register for My Gloucester

Information for landlords

As a landlord, you're responsible for council tax if:

  • Your property is a house in multiple occupation (HMO)
  • Your property is empty between tenants
  • Your tenants are all full-time students

Tell us when tenants move in or out so we can update our records.

Final bills and refunds

When you move, we'll send you a final bill showing:

  • What you've paid so far
  • What you owe up to your moving date
  • Any refund you're due

Refunds: If you've paid too much, we'll refund you automatically. This usually takes about 10 working days.

Money owing: If you still owe money after you move, you must pay this. We'll send you details of how to pay.

Important

Tell us about your move as soon as possible, even if you don't know your exact moving date yet.
